entry.title: Methodology Chapter Outline
entry.content:
Methodology

Research Design (or Research Framework)

  • Importance of ontology, epistemology, axiology, and methodology in research design (Creswell 2013)
  • Applied Critical Realism offers a cohesive approach (Edwards et al. 2014; Fletcher 2013, 2017)

Applied Critical Realism

  • Distinguish from constructivism and positivism
  • Three layer ontology – empirical, actual, real
  • Ontology > epistemology
  • Distinct modes of analysis – description, abduction, retroduction
  • Goal to explain and identify causal mechanisms
  • Explanation rather than thick description or hypothesis testing
  • Intensive and extensive methods
  • Sources:
    • Fletcher (2013)
    • Fletcher (2017)
    • Edwards et al. (2014)
    • Easton (2010)
    • Canonical texts in CR?
      • Collier (1994)
      • Sayer (1992)
      • Maxwell (2012)

Justification for Using Applied CR

  • As a means to explicate theory of change (what changes for whom and why) and identify causal mechanisms
  • Accounts for structure and agency
  • Useful to develop a theory explaining the existence of nonprofit access to benefits programs, the limitations on their agency, and identify causal mechanisms for and resulting from their existence (what causes their existence AND what effects do they have)

Comparative Case Study Approach

  • Between historical movements to increase access to welfare state income benefits and contemporary nonprofit access to benefits programs.
  • Between local, contemporary access to benefits programs to identify the range of program models
  • Identify and analyze the results of each case (redistribution, punitive measures), the interventions utilized, agents involved, structural influences, and causal mechanisms (barriers to / resources for agency towards redistribution).
  • Sources:
    • Edwards et al. (2014)

Data Collection

Semi-structured Interviews

  • Semi-structured qualitative interviews
  • Number of interviews completed
  • Rationale for number of interviews (saturation? response rate? time and resource constraints?)
  • Length
  • Participant profile
  • Location
  • Date range
  • Honoraria provided
  • Recruitment strategy / sampling method
  • Transcription process
  • Reference to Interview Guide in Appendix
  • Sources:
    • Edwards et al. (2014)
    • Kvale and Brinkmann (2015)
    • Kvale (2007)
    • Turner (2010)

Document Review

  • Review of documents that structure and describe the structures of the contemporary field
  • Public documents, FIPPA requests, and documents shared by participants
  • List of documents consulted (separate references page?)
  • Sources:
    • Edwards et al. (2014)
    • Other sources on document review / analysis?

Data Analysis

  • Goal to explain what is happening in the field and the relationship between ongoing practice and socioeconomic justice
  • Analyze transcripts and documents with an emphasis on uncovering causal mechanisms that can explain the field being studied
  • Used RQDA software for computer-assisted qualitative data analysis
  • Why RQDA
  • Sources:
    • Chandra and Shang (2017)
    • Varner et al. (2012)

Coding

  • Provisional coding – deductive codes from theory and literature review
  • Negative case analysis – to not allow deductive codes to overdetermine analysis
  • CR coding – identify structure and agency
  • Per case coding – to ensure connection between participants and their responses, to avoid overabstraction
  • Results of coding: number of codes in each phase; types of codes; how the codes changed through the iterative process
  • Sources:
    • c.f. Fletcher (2013)
    • Fletcher (2017)
    • Gilgun (2014)

Ethical and Epistemological Considerations

  • TCPS2 CORE course
  • Approval of research involving human subjects by PSREB
  • Confidentiality measures
  • Informed Consent
  • Reference to Consent Form in Appendix
  • Sources:
    • Canadian Institutes of Health Research, Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada, and Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (2014)
    • University of Manitoba Fort Garry Campus Research Ethics Boards (2013)

Insider Research

  • Managing my role as an insider researcher (benefits and drawbacks of being an insider; precautions taken)
  • Reflexivity via research log
  • Sources:
    • Floyd and Arthur (2012)
    • Unluer (2012)
    • Coghlan (2007) (maybe)

Limitations

  • Generalizability
  • Insider position

Questions for Mara

  • Any sections to add / remove / rename / reorder?
  • How much methodological literature to cite?
  • How much do I need to justify my approach with reference to the literature?
  • Fletcher’s work is a huge influence for me. Can I follow her methodology and directly state that I am doing so with slight modifications?

Canadian Institutes of Health Research, Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada, and Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada. 2014. Tri-Council Policy Statement: Ethical Conduct for Research Involving Humans. Retrieved March 28, 2018 (http://www.pre.ethics.gc.ca/pdf/eng/tcps2-2014/TCPS_2_FINAL_Web.pdf).

Chandra, Yanto and Liang Shang. 2017. “An RQDA-Based Constructivist Methodology for Qualitative Research.” Qualitative Market Research: An International Journal 20(1):90–112. Retrieved August 24, 2018 (http://www.emeraldinsight.com/doi/10.1108/QMR-02-2016-0014).

Coghlan, David. 2007. “Insider Action Research: Opportunities and Challenges.” Management Research News 30(5):335–43. Retrieved December 30, 2016 (http://www.emeraldinsight.com.uml.idm.oclc.org/doi/full/10.1108/01409170710746337).

Collier, Andrew. 1994. Critical Realism: An Introduction to Roy Bhaskar’s Philosophy. S.l: Verso.

Creswell, John W. 2013. Qualitative Inquiry and Research Design: Choosing Among Five Approaches. 3rd Edition. Los Angeles: SAGE Publications.

Easton, Geoff. 2010. “Critical Realism in Case Study Research.” Industrial Marketing Management 39(1):118–28. Retrieved January 9, 2017 (http://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S0019850109001424).

Edwards, Paul K., Joe O’Mahoney, Steve Vincent, and Inc ebrary. 2014. Studying Organizations Using Critical Realism A Practical Guide. 1st ed.. Oxford, U.K.: Oxford University Press. Retrieved January 9, 2017 (http://site.ebrary.com/lib/umanitoba/docDetail.action?docID=10848637).

Fletcher, Amber J. 2017. “Applying Critical Realism in Qualitative Research: Methodology Meets Method.” International Journal of Social Research Methodology 20(2):181–94. Retrieved January 9, 2017 (http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/13645579.2016.1144401).

Fletcher, Amber JoAnn. 2013. “The View from Here: Agricultural Policy, Climate Change, and the Future of Farm Women in Saskatchewan.” Thesis, Faculty of Graduate Studies and Research, University of Regina. Retrieved January 21, 2017 (http://ourspace.uregina.ca:8080/xmlui/handle/10294/5407).

Floyd, Alan and Linet Arthur. 2012. “Researching from Within: External and Internal Ethical Engagement.” International Journal of Research & Method in Education 35(2):171–80. Retrieved May 8, 2017 (http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/1743727X.2012.670481).

Gilgun, Jane. 2014. “Introduction to the Chicago School: Deductive Qualitative Analysis and Grounded Theory.”

Kvale, Steinar. 2007. Doing Interviews. 1 Oliver’s Yard, 55 City Road, London England EC1Y 1SP United Kingdom: SAGE Publications, Ltd. Retrieved January 2, 2017 (http://methods.sagepub.com/book/doing-interviews).

Kvale, Steinar and Svend Brinkmann. 2015. InterViews : Learning the Craft of Qualitative Research Interviewing. Third edition.. Los Angeles: Sage Publications.

Maxwell, Joseph A. 2012. A Realist Approach for Qualitative Research. SAGE.

Sayer, Andrew. 1992. Method in Social Science: A Realist Approach. Taylor & Francis.

Turner, Daniel. 2010. “Qualitative Interview Design: A Practical Guide for Novice Investigators.” The Qualitative Report 15(3):754–60. Retrieved (http://nsuworks.nova.edu/tqr/vol15/iss3/19).

University of Manitoba Fort Garry Campus Research Ethics Boards. 2013. “Human Subject Research. Ethics Protocol Submissions (Ft. Garry Campus). Guidelines for Submissions & Reviews.” Retrieved March 28, 2018 (http://umanitoba.ca/research/orec/media/Human_Subject_Research_Guidelines.pdf).

Unluer, Sema. 2012. “Being an Insider Researcher While Conducting Case Study Research.” Qualitative Report 17:58. Retrieved March 11, 2015 (http://eric.ed.gov/?id=EJ981455).

Varner, Lindsey D., Aundrea Carter, Robert Furter, and Holly Downs. 2012.“R QUALITATIVE DATA ANALYSIS (RQDA) PACKAGE: A FREE QUALITATIVE DATA ANALYSIS TOOL. Learn How to Import and Work with Interview Data in R.” Greensboro, NC.

Methodology Chapter Outline was originally published by Kevin Schachter at Confessions of a Futbol Revolutionist on August 24, 2018.
